intro: Ptisana microcarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pittosporum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pittosporaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Ptisana microcarpa is often found in coastal and lowland areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
